channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024070389
item.description:
Report E-2024070389

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 11, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3109 had a faulty lid and released approximately three (3) ounces of product to the cap of the tote. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE unscrewed the lid, and replaced it with a brand new vented lid. The damaged lid was placed into one (1) 5-gallon container which was left onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024070417
item.description:
Report E-2024070417

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: GARDEN CITY
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- XDE contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 250-gallon metal tote containing hazardous product, Zinc Octoate 8%. A Contractor discovered that the lid to the tote was loose and likely the cause of the release. It was estimated that 5-gallons of product spilled from the lid impacting the metal tote itself, the wooden trailer floor, and the steel grate on trailer floor. The total impact are was estimated to be 6’x6’. The Contractor was able to tighten the lid and perform a slosh test confirming that adjustments made to the lid were successful and the tote is in proper working order to ship on to the Consignee. One 55-gallon DM was generated for waste disposal containing impacted cardboard, PPE, and absorbent pads/rags. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident

item.title: Report E-2024070295
item.description:
Report E-2024070295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-16T09:14:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: BYRON CENTER
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
